meanings.sent1: The artist created detailed miniatures of famous landmarks.
meanings.sent2: She collected tiny miniatures of animals for her dollhouse.
meanings.sent3: The miniature of the Eiffel Tower was so small, it could fit in the palm of your hand.
meanings.sent4: His collection of miniatures was like a tiny world in itself.
meanings.sent5: The miniature of the car was so realistic, it looked like a toy for giants.

meanings.definition: A very small painting, especially a portrait, on ivory, vellum, or paper.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed exquisite miniatures of historical figures.
meanings.sent2: She admired the delicate miniature of a lady in a Victorian dress.
meanings.sent3: The miniature of the queen was so tiny, you needed a magnifying glass to see her face clearly.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of miniatures was like a gallery of tiny masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The miniature of the ship was so finely detailed, it looked like it could sail off the page.
